intro: Delphinium ithaburense, commonly known as the Tibetan larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other familiar genera like buttercups and anemones. Delphinium ithaburense is adapted to cold, arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
